Articles.Content:
Running KSP 1.9.1 on Linux Mint

Mods: KER, KAC, NavBall Docking Alignment Indicator, Precise Maneuver,  Transfer Window Planner, WayPoint Manager

Just upgraded to 1.9.1 and everything seemed to be working just find. However, When I have a target selected for docking, as I approach, I don't have any indication of where my target is. Used to having the brackets [ ] and a distance i.e. 650m show in view. Right now nothing, and only can see my target ship if I manage to get with 200m or so. NavBall looks good so I can kinda get there but with no distance reference, makes it really difficult to judge approach speed.

Is there a setting I need to adjust?
Did you accidentally hit F4 - that toggles the target marker on & off.  I've hit it by mistake (instead of quicksave) and didn't realize a few times.
That fixed it...  didn't know about F4 toggle...  problem solved! Thanks mucho!
